14/ iâ€™m now working on content for web3 companies/DAOs and harnessing my talent for storytelling as a non-technical user

14/ although i had no prior knowledge, i was eager to learn

13/ to me web3 was the perfect culmination of what i was interested in: 

ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» governance 
ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» creator economy

12/ but with DAOs and bounties and part-time work and new projects so prevalent in the space, i realized that i could carve out my own back door just by pursuing non-traditional opportunities

i started building a brand on twitter and sharing my experiences

11/ the beginning of my web3 journey was difficult. i thought that my first step was to secure a web3 job.

i didnâ€™t have ANY technical experience or prior experience at a tech company/VC 

i was getting ghosted left and right

10/ in january of 2021 i quit my job

9/ i realized i didnâ€™t dislike the company, i just hated the idea that we were always operating in service to giant platforms. 

i stumbled upon @ljin18â€™s articles in my search for US investorsâ€¦

â€¦and started thinking about the creator economy in a different way

8/ but working at a chinese social media startup had given me the following: 

1) the ability to work under immense time pressure â°
2) an understanding the creator economy in the worldâ€™s largest market ğŸ’¹
3) adaptability to uncertain conditionsâ“

7/ but two raises and two promotions later, i felt burnt out

the direction wasnâ€™t working and i had to accept that maybe i had chosen the wrong career path, *again* 

(keep in mind, i had just spent 4 years chasing law school forâ€¦nothing) ğŸ“‰

6/ i spent hours incubating creators we had literally recruited from random group chats from 0 to 55k+ followers on tiktok

& i was given more responsibility than i ever dreamed of

5/ as the only american on the team: 

i was responsible for onboarding and managing ALL of our foreign social media influencers, + helping them produce in-house content 

it also allowed me to execute things the rest of the team couldnâ€™t

4/ i decided to make a quick career switch â¡ï¸ and started working at a chinese social media/e-commerce startup desperate for foreign hires

(my first experience in private industry)

3/ but COVID had really altered my sense of things. pursuing law didnâ€™t feel right anymore â˜¹ï¸
